info.title: Payments
info.description:
Use a single API that orchestrates the payment flow to include FraudSight, 3DS and Token creation.

__Authentication__

Set your headers 

```   
Authorization: {your_credentials}    
Content-Type: application/json    
WP-Api-Version: 2024-06-01
```    

Replace `{your_credentials}` with your base64-encoded Basic Auth username and password.  

__DNS whitelisting__

Whitelist the following URLs:    
* `https://try.access.worldpay.com/`
* `https://access.worldpay.com/`

Please ensure you use DNS whitelisting, not explicit IP whitelisting. When you make a request within Access Worldpay, you should always cache the response returned. 

__API collection__

A full set of API examples based on different scenarios. 

 * __[Download Postman collection](./collections/index.md)__

tags.name: 3DS Actions
tags.description: If 3DS is enabled additional actions are required

post.description: Initiate Payment. Take merchant entity as default if not provided

Gather additional device data. `linkData` refers to the pre-encoded segment of the URL that uniquely identifies a payment resource. It appears immediately after `/payments/` and continues until the next `/` or URL delimiter.

Verify authentication challenge. `linkData` refers to the pre-encoded segment of the URL that uniquely identifies a payment resource. It appears immediately after /payments/ and continues until the next / or URL delimiter.

get.description: Query a payment. `linkData` refers to the pre-encoded segment of the URL that uniquely identifies a payment resource. It appears immediately after `/payments/` and continues until the next `/` or URL delimiter.

post.description: Settle a payment. `linkData` refers to the pre-encoded segment of the URL that uniquely identifies a payment resource. It appears immediately after `/payments/` and continues until the next `/` or URL delimiter.

post.summary: Submit a payment partial settle request
post.description: Partially settle a payment. `linkData` refers to the pre-encoded segment of the URL that uniquely identifies a payment resource. It appears immediately after `/payments/` and continues until the next `/` or URL delimiter.

Refund a payment. `linkData` refers to the pre-encoded segment of the URL that uniquely identifies a payment resource. It appears immediately after `/payments/` and continues until the next `/` or URL delimiter.

post.summary: Submit a payment partial refund request
post.description: Partially refund a payment. `linkData` refers to the pre-encoded segment of the URL that uniquely identifies a payment resource. It appears immediately after `/payments/` and continues until the next `/` or URL delimiter.

Cancel a payment. `linkData` refers to the pre-encoded segment of the URL that uniquely identifies a payment resource. It appears immediately after `/payments/` and continues until the next `/` or URL delimiter.

PaymentsLink.description: Return details about the status of the payment

PaymentsSequence.description: The sequence number and total number of expected partial settlement requests for the payment.

currency.description: The three character currency code. See list of supported currencies

amount.description:
The payment amount. Implied decimal. For example, 250 GBP = 2.50
When set to `0` will perform a card verification instead of a payment as part of a new `customerAgreement`.

PaymentsActionPartialSettle.description: Partially settle the payment. See [details](../payments-lifecycle/partialsettle) including what to add in the request body.

collectionReference.description:
Add the `sessionId` provided in the [postMessage for the device data collection form (web)](/products/payments/enable-features/3ds-authentication/web) or for native (iOS/Android), returned as `consumerSessionId` as part of [SDK initialization](/products/payments/enable-features/3ds-authentication/android-ios).

__Note:__ If device data collection fails you can attempt the payment without this value, but you will see an increased number of `challenged` and even `authenticationFailed` outcomes, if this happens for a lot of requests.

Advice.description: Contains suggested next actions for this request.

version.description: The version of 3DS used to process the transaction.

eci.description: Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI). Indicates the outcome of the 3DS authentication.

Authentication.description: Object that contains authentication related information.

postalCode.description: Required for all countries except the following:            * IE

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

riskFactors.description: Any risk factors which have been identified for the authorization. This section will not appear if no risks are identified.

schemeReference.description: An object containing information returned by the scheme.

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.
A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

ExpiryDate.description: Contains your customer's card or token expiry date.

outcome.description: outcome of the fraud assessment. `highRisk` outcomes stop the transaction before payment.

score.description: The score calculated by the fraud assessment, set score thresholds are used to define lowRisk, highRisk and review outcomes

Fraud.description: Details of the outcome of the Fraud assessment

Issuer.description: An object containing information returned by the issuer.

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

riskFactors.description: Any risk factors which have been identified for the authorization. This section will not appear if no risks are identified.

PaymentsActionComplete3dsChallenge.description: Resume the payment following the 3DS challenge being completed by the customer. See [details](../3ds-actions/complete3dschallenge)

granted.description: Was an exemption returned by Worldpay's TRA assessment.

placement.description: Indicates whether the exemption has been placed in a payment authorization request or 3DS authentication request.

x-enumDescriptions.authorization: Exemption applied in the payment authorization.

result.description: The result of the exemption placement request.

reason.description: The reason returned by the card issuer.

PaymentsExemption.description: An object containing information about the exemption.

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

RiskFactor.description: Any risk factors which have been identified for the authorization. This section will not appear if no risks are identified.

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

appliedNetworkToken.description: Returned if the payment instrument was swapped for a network token.

accountUpdaterMessage.description: Details on the type of payment instrument update.
enum: The merchant is not registered in the update program
The issuing bank does not participate in the update program
Contact the cardholder for updated information

cardBin.description: The updated card BIN (Bank Identification Number).

lastFour.description: The four digits of the updated card. Some characters may be obfuscated with a * if the PAN length is less than 16 characters.

cardBrand.description: The brand of the updated card. In rare circumstances a card may be reissued under a different brand.

UpdatedPaymentInstrument.description: Details of the updated payment instrument.

outcome.description: If the request was authenticated successfully or an authentication outage exemption was applied in authorization. See details on [Authentication Outage](/products/payments/enable-features/3ds-authentication#how-to-enable-authentication-outage-exemptions)

issuerResponse.description: If the issuer decides to challenge the customer or proceed (frictionless)

version.description: The version of 3DS used to process the transaction.

eci.description:
Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI). Indicates the outcome of the 3DS authentication.

| ECI | Meaning |
| --- | --- |
| 02 or 05 | Fully Authenticated Transaction
| 01 or 06 | Attempted Authentication Transaction
| 00 or 07 | Non 3-D Secure Transaction

| Scheme | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Mastercard | 02, 01, 00 |
| Visa | 05, 06, 07 |
| Amex | 05, 06, 07 |
| JCB | 05, 06, 07 |
| Diners | 05, 06, 07 |

acsTransactionId.description: An identifier assigned by the Access Control Server (ACS) to identify a single transaction. Used primarily for Mastercard 3RI subsequent transactions to link the subsequent transaction back to a previous cardholder authentication. Can be disregarded unless otherwise needed.

dsTransactionId.description: Directory server transaction Id, if provided should be used in the payment authorization authentication object.

status.description:
Indicates the outcome of the authentication or verification request.
- `Y` - Successful authentication
- `N` - Failed authentication
- `U` - Unable to complete authentication
- `A` - Successful attempts authentication
- `C` - Challenged authentication
- `R` - Authentication rejected (merchant _must not_ submit for authorization)
- `I` - Exemption acknowledged

challengePreference.description:
Indicates the preferred challenge behavior. __Returned for Cartes Bancaires authentications only__ and must be applied in the following authorization request.
- `noPreference`
- `noChallengeRequested`
- `challengeRequested`
- `challengeMandated`
- `noChallengeRequestedTRAPerformed`

Verification.description: Details of the outcome of the 3DS authentication

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.
A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

riskFactors.description: Any risk factors which have been identified for the authorization. This section will not appear if no risks are identified.

schemeReference.description: An object containing information returned by the scheme.

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

riskFactors.description: Any risk factors which have been identified for the authorization. This section will not appear if no risks are identified.

schemeReference.description: An object containing information returned by the scheme.

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

createdAt.description: Date the customer account was created.

modifiedAt.description: Date the customer account was last modified.

passwordModifiedAt.description: Date the password for the customer account was last modified.

paymentAccountEnrolledAt.description: Date the payment account was added to the cardholder account.

debtRepayment.description: A flag which identifies a payment as being for the purpose of repaying a debt.

consumerBillPayment.description: An attribute that identifies a bill payment paid by providers on behalf of consumers. If you are registered with Visa as a Consumer of the Bill Payment Service (CBPS), you must set this to `true` for any payments associated with the CBPS.

requestAccountUpdater.description: Allows you to request a real-time account update (Visa cards only) when using a previously stored card. You can only use this on subsequent card requests.

cvcNotMatched.description: By default a payment will be `sentForCancellation` if the CVC is `notMatched`, set `disabled` to continue with `sentForSettlement`.

avsNotMatched.description: By default a payment will be `sentForCancellation` if the `address` or `postcode` AVS is `notMatched`, set `disabled` to continue with `sentForSettlement`.

Cancellation.description: Configuration for when a payment is `sentForCancellation` automatically.

debtRepayment.description: A flag which identifies a payment as being for the purpose of repaying a debt.

consumerBillPayment.description: An attribute that identifies a bill payment paid by providers on behalf of consumers. If you are registered with Visa as a Consumer of the Bill Payment Service (CBPS), you must set this to `true` for any payments associated with the CBPS.

requestAccountUpdater.description: Allows you to request a real-time account update (Visa cards only) when using a previously stored card. You can only use this on subsequent card requests.

returnUrl.description: Once the customer completes the challenge page the issuer redirects/posts to the returnUrl in order for you to resume the session. It must be the full URL path.

windowSize.description: Specify the challenge window size (width x height) that the issuer should use. This is to better tailor the experience to the customers device. Default is 390x400.

preference.description: Set a preference for how the Issuer decides on a 3DS challenge.

Challenge.description: An object containing 3DS challenge preferences and configuration.

Custom.description: Additional values specific to your order that can be used to create manual fraud rules.

customerId.description: Unique identifier used by the ecommerce system for the customer.

email.description: Customers's email address used for the ecommerce account.

ipAddress.description:
A unique identifier for your customer's physical location that
            can be used by the issuer in risk analysis. Must be in IPv4 or IPv6 format.
E.g. 192.0.0.0.

documentReference.description: Required for domestic processing in some Latin American countries.

acceptHeader.description: Used by the issuer to check if the customer's browser is compatible with the issuer 3DS challenge display.

userAgentHeader.description: Used by issuers as part of risk analysis and correctly displaying the challenge. Must conform to RFC 7321.

browserLanguage.description: Your customer's browser language that can be used by the issuer in risk analysis. Must conform to the language tags defined by IETF. E.g. en-GB, fr-FR.

browserJavaEnabled.description: Defines whether Java is enabled on your customers browser.

browserColorDepth.description: The color depth of your customers browser

browserScreenHeight.description: Defines the pixel height of the customers browser.

browserScreenWidth.description: Defines the pixel width of the customers browser.

timeZone.description:
Time zone offset in minutes between UTC and your customer's browser local time.  
Example time zone offset values in minutes:  
If UTC -5 hours:  
`300`  
`+300`  
If UTC +5 hours:  
`-300`

browserJavascriptEnabled.description: Defines whether Javascript is enabled on your customers browser.

channel.description: Determines the channel that the transaction came through. `native` should only be set if using the Cardinal 3DS SDK (iOS/Android)

DeviceData.description: An object containing device data for 3DS & Fraud assessment.

type.description:
Ask for an SCA exemption recommendation directly from Worldpay (integrated) or use a 3rd party TRA solution.
__Note:__ Only type `integrated` is supported for now.

mode.description: Specify which transactions to request SCA Exemptions for.

capability.description:
Indicates whether the exemption requested from Worldpay can return a placement of authorization (payment) and/or authentication (3DS).
__Note:__ Only exemptions in authorization are supported for now.

Exemption.description:
An object used to request or specify an SCA Exemption. 

Read more on how to set it up under our [__SCA Exemptions__](/products/payments/enable-features/sca-exemptions) guide.

debtRepayment.description: A flag which identifies a payment as being for the purpose of repaying a debt.

consumerBillPayment.description: An attribute that identifies a bill payment paid by providers on behalf of consumers. If you are registered with Visa as a Consumer of the Bill Payment Service (CBPS), you must set this to `true` for any payments associated with the CBPS.

requestAccountUpdater.description: Allows you to request a real-time account update (Visa cards only) when using a previously stored card. You can only use this on subsequent card requests.

numberOfInstallments.description: Number of installments that the requested amount should be broken into.

InstallmentPlan.description: Required only for `latinAmerica` installment type. Not allowed for `merchant` installment type.

entity.description: Used to route the request in Access Worldpay, created as part of on-boarding.

mcc.description: You can apply a merchant category code (mcc) to an individual request. You can only provide an mcc if we have enabled the dynamic mcc feature during boarding. If enabled but not provided, merchant.mcc defaults to a configured value.

Merchant.description: An object that contains information about the merchant.

line1.description: line1 is used to provide basic details about the merchant.

line2.description: line2 is used for additional context about the payment or merchant. E.g. Order number or Merchant phone number.

Narrative.description: The text that appears on your customer's statement. Used to identify the merchant.

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

channel.description:
Interaction between the cardholder and you. Supply a value of `ecom` to process an eCommerce authorization. Supply a value of `moto` to process an authorization as a [__Mail Order or Telephone Order__](/products/payments/enable-features/moto) transaction.

__Note: 3DS authentication cannot be supplied for MOTO payments__.

iban.description: The International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the recipient. Required if `identifierType` is `iban`

accountNumber.description: The account number of the recipient. Required if `identifierType` is `routingNumber` or `swift`

swiftBic.description: The SWIFT Bank Identification Code (BIC) of the recipient. Required if `identifierType` is `swift`. Must be either 8 or 11 alphanumeric characters.

routingNumber.description: The ABA (American Bankers Association) Routing Transit Number (RTN). Identifies the Financial Insititution of the recipient's account. Required if `identifierType` is `routingNumber`. Must be 9 numeric characters.

storedCardUsage.description: Set to `first` to store a card or `subsequent` to use a previously stored card.

cardHolderName.description: The name on your customer's card. Required if  instruction.tokenCreation is present. However we recommend that you supply this to improve authentication rates.

cvc.description: CVC is a unique set of 3 or 4 numbers on the back of the card. Our API checks to see if the CVC supplied matches the CVC held by the issuing bank.

type.description: The processing arrangement agreed with your customer.

PaymentsCustomerAgreement.description: Contains specific customer agreements for the transaction.

silentMode.description:
Perform the Fraud assessment but do not act on the outcome.
            Normally used for the initial launch while the data model is maturing.

PaymentsFraud.description:
Fraud assessment to detect potential fraud and prevent the transaction from proceeding.

Read more on how to set it up under our [__Fraud Assessment__](/products/payments/enable-features/fraud-assessment) guide.

documentReference.description: Required for domestic processing in some Latin American countries.

PaymentsFundsRecipient.description: An object containing details about the recipient of funds, including name and address information, as well as recipient account details. In many use cases, the recipient is the same person as the sender (for example if your customer uses their card to load funds into their own crypto exchange or investment account). __Although an optional object in the API schema, `recipient` is required for some regions and use cases.__

firstName.description: Sender's first name. Must be supplied if `lastName` or `middleName` are provided.

lastName.description: Sender's last name. Must be supplied if `firstName` or `middleName` are provided.

documentReference.description: Sender's document reference (e.g. Tax ID). Required for domestic processing in some Latin American countries.

PaymentsFundsSender.description: An object containing details about the sender of funds, including name and address information. The sender account is always the card account declared within `instruction.paymentInstrument`. __Although an optional object in the API schema, `sender` is required for some regions and use cases.__

type.description: Specifies the type of the funds transfer. {% admonition type="warning" name="Note" %} You may only submit the `fundsTransfer.type` values that relate to the use cases that you have been approved for by the schemes.{% /admonition %}

x-enumDescriptions.disbursement: A card is used as the source of funds for a disbursement
x-enumDescriptions.personToPerson: Move funds to an account owned by another person (eg gifts)
x-enumDescriptions.accountToAccount: Move funds to another financial institution account owned by the same person
x-enumDescriptions.topUp: Top up a pre-paid or debit card
x-enumDescriptions.purchase: For the initial purchase of a reloadable account (such as prepaid or gift card), or direct crypto & liquid asset purchases without an intermediary wallet load
x-enumDescriptions.cash: A card is used to fund a transfer where funds are given to the recipient in cash
x-enumDescriptions.walletLoad: Move funds to a digital wallet owned by the same person

purpose.description: Specifies the purpose of the funds transfer. Required for some regions and use cases (eg crypto).

PaymentsFundsTransfer.description:
Contains details of the funds transfer request, which is a money movement for a reason other than the purchase of goods or services (also known as Account Funding Transaction (AFT)).

Read more on how to set it up under our [__Account Funding Transactions__](/products/payments/enable-features/account-funding-transactions) guide.

quantity.description: The number of gift cards being purchased.

PaymentsGiftCardsPurchase.description: If the order is being used to purchase a gift card.

storedCardUsage.description: Set to `first` to store a card or `subsequent` to use a previously stored card. Mandatory for `merchant` installment type.

installmentType.description:
Defines the type of installments service. 

Read more on how to set up [__Latin America Installments__](/products/payments/enable-features/latam-installments) under our guide.

schemeReference.description: Optional field available only for `subsequent` storedCardUsage. Unique reference provided by card schemes used to link the `first` and `subsequent` payments. If a Worldpay token was created as part of the first payment, this value is bundled with the token and does not need to be provided again. If you manage multiple agreements for a single cardholder using a token, please use the `schemeReference` returned to you. This allows you to distinguish and manage each separate agreement appropriately.

debtRepayment.description: A flag which identifies a payment as being for the purpose of repaying a debt.

consumerBillPayment.description: An attribute that identifies a bill payment paid by providers on behalf of consumers. If you are registered with Visa as a Consumer of the Bill Payment Service (CBPS), you must set this to `true` for any payments associated with the CBPS.

requestAccountUpdater.description: Allows you to request a real-time account update (Visa cards only) when using a previously stored card. You can only use this on subsequent card requests.

PaymentsInstruction.description: An object that contains all information related to the payment and API configurations.

cardHolderName.description: The name as shown on the card.

cryptogram.description:
The single-use cryptogram provisioned for this payment. Required for all Customer Initiated Transactions (CITs).

__Note:__ If the `cryptogram` and `eci` are not provided, the Payments API will __automatically__ attempt to provision them. This will only be successful for Network Tokens created via Worldpay. For Network Tokens created via other gateways you must provide these.

schemeId.description: Your payment facilitator ID received from Mastercard, Visa and Amex.

independentSalesOrganizationId.description: Independent Sales Organization (ISO) ID provided by Mastercard.

PaymentsPaymentFacilitator.description: An object containing Payment Facilitator information. This information is required for every authorization [__only if you are a Payment Facilitator__](/products/payments/enable-features/payment-facilitator)

accountReference.description: The account number of the recipient. Either a bank account number or a partial card number.

lastName.description: The last name of the recipient.

PaymentsRecipient.description:
An object containing information about the recipient of financial services. Required for MCC 6012 transactions in the Visa Europe region. The recipient may or may not be the cardholder.

Read more on how to set it up under our [__Financial Services__](/products/payments/enable-features/financial-services-mcc6012-mcc6051) guide.

PaymentsRecipientAccount.description: An object for the account details of the recipient.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the recipient. Relevant only in the UK.

countryCode.description: The supported ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code

socialNetworkReference.description: A reference identifying recipient's social network account.

name.description: The name of your subMerchant's company.

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of your subMerchant's company.

taxReference.description: Tax Reference of your subMerchant's company.

email.description: Email address of your subMerchant's company.

postalCode.description: Post code/Zip code of your subMerchant's company.

street.description: Street name of your subMerchant's company.

countryCode.description: Country code of your subMerchant's company in [ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 format](/products/reference/supported-countries-currencies#iso-country-codes).

storedCardUsage.description: Set to `first` to store a card or `subsequent` to use a previously stored card.

schemeReference.description: Optional field available only for `subsequent` storedCardUsage. Unique reference provided by card schemes used to link the `first` and `subsequent` payments. If a Worldpay token was created as part of the first payment, this value is bundled with the token and does not need to be provided again. If you manage multiple agreements for a single cardholder using a token, please use the `schemeReference` returned to you. This allows you to distinguish and manage each separate agreement appropriately.

exemptionOnOutage.description: Attempt authorization (without liability shift) using an authentication outage exemption in the event of a 3DS network failure. Even with this boolean set it is not currently part of default merchant setup. See [how to enable authentication outage exemptions](/products/payments/enable-features/3ds-authentication#how-to-enable-authentication-outage-exemptions)

previousSuspiciousActivity.description: Has the account been flagged for suspicious activity.

preOrderDate.description: Expected date that a pre-ordered purchase will be available.

PaymentsThreeDS.description:
An object containing 3DS authentication preferences.

Read more on how to set it up under our [__3DS Authentication__](/products/payments/enable-features/3ds-authentication) guide.

address1.description: Must be supplied if `city` is provided.

city.description: Must be supplied if `address1` is provided.

schemeReference.description: Unique reference provided by card schemes used to link the `first` and `subsequent` payments. This value is bundled with the Worldpay token if created as part of the `first` payment and therefore not required here as well. If you manage multiple agreements for a single cardholder using a token, please use the `schemeReference` returned to you. This allows you to distinguish and manage each separate agreement appropriately.

walletReference.description: A reference identifying the destination wallet.

preferredCardBrand.description: Specifies your customer's preferred card brand to be used for the transaction using a co-badged card.

Routing.description: An object containing specific routing preferences.

sessionHref.description: An http address that contains your Checkout session providing the card details.

cardHolderName.description: The name on your customer's card. Required if  instruction.tokenCreation is present. However we recommend that you supply this to improve authentication rates.

Settlement.description:
Automatically settle a payment following authorization. If any of the AVS/CVC response riskFactors are marked as `notMatched` the payment will be `sentForCancellation` automatically.

Read more on how to set it up under our [__Auto Settlement__](/products/payments/enable-features/auto-settlement) guide.

email.description: The email address used for an electronic delivery.

phone.description: The phone number used for delivery.

firstName.description: First name used on the shipping address.

lastName.description: Last name used on the shipping address.

namespace.description: A namespace is used to group up to 16 cards, e.g. for one customer. A card can exist in more than one namespace.

description.description: A description of your token. If not supplied, a default description is created for you.

TokenCreation.description: Use this object if you want to create a token after the payment. Can only be used with paymentInstrument.type: card/plain & checkout.

href.description: An http address that contains your link to an Access Token.

cvc.description: CVC is a unique set of 3 or 4 numbers on the back of the card. Our API checks to see if the CVC supplied matches the CVC held by the issuing bank.

cvcSessionHref.description: Href to the Checkout session providing the Card Verification Code (CVC).__Note:__ Provide a value in `cvcSessionHref` or `cvc`, never both.

attemptsLastDay.description: Number of transactions (successful or abandoned) for this cardholder account within the last 24 hours.

attemptsLastYear.description: Number of transactions (successful or abandoned) for this cardholder account within the last year.

completedLastSixMonths.description: Number of purchases with this customer account during the previous six months.

addCardsLastDay.description: Number of attempts to add a card in the last 24hrs.

shippingAddressFirstUsedAt.description: When the shipping address used for the transaction was first used.

TransactionHistory.description: Object containing details of the last transaction.

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

jwt.description: A digitally signed token that contains additional details required for DDC.

url.description: A `POST` action on the DDC form. Used to redirect to the issuers DDC page. This URL can could change so should not be hardcoded.

bin.description: First six digits of the card number (Bank Identification Number), used as part of DDC.

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.
A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

score.description: Percentage assessment score for the transaction. Higher the value the greater the assessed risk. The outcome value is based on the thresholds configured using this score.

reason.description: Short description of the reason for the outcome. A reason can be returned for any 'outcome', even lowRisk.

items.description: Short description of the reason for the outcome. A reason can be returned for any 'outcome', even lowRisk.

PaymentsActionSupply3dsDeviceData.description: Supply the 3DS device data collectionReference (SessionId) to continue the payment. See [details](../3ds-actions/supply3dsdevicedata) including what to add in the request body.

transactionReference.description: A unique reference generated by you that is used to identify a payment throughout its lifecycle.

value.message: A JSON body matching the expected schema must be provided.

validationErrors.message: Field at path is not allowed.

value.message: Access to the requested resource has been denied.
A valid header must be provided.
A valid header must be provided.
We cannot currently process your request. Please contact support.

card-payment.description: A one-off card payment using a plain card number

card-payment_moto.description: A one-off MOTO card payment using a plain card number

card-payment-auto-settlement.description:
A guest card payment using a plain card number. The payment will move to `authorize` and `send for settlement` if basic CVC/AVS checks pass.

__We recommend disabling cancel on avsNotMatched/cvcNotMatched as shown in the example.__

card-payment-3ds.description:
A one-off card payment using a plain card number that also performs 3DS authentication.  
* Values that are [required by the schemes](/products/payments/enable-features/3ds-authentication/#emvco-required-values) are included in this example. 
* See [how to enable 3DS authentication](/products/payments/enable-features/3ds-authentication/) for integration details

card-payment-exemption-authorization.description:
A guest card payment using a plain card number that also performs 3DS authentication.  
* Values [required by the schemes](/products/payments/enable-features/3ds-authentication/#emvco-required-values) are included in this example
* See [how to enable an exemption in authorization](/products/payments/enable-features/sca-exemptions/) for integration details

card-payment-fraud.description:
A one-off card payment using a plain card number that also performs a fraud assessment
* See [how to enable fraud assessment](/products/payments/enable-features/fraud-assessment) for details

card-payment-payfac.description: A one-off payment facilitator card payment using a plain card number

card-payment-fundsTransfer.description: A one-off cryptocurrency wallet load card payment using a plain card number

card-payment-cobranded.description: A one-off card payment using a plain card number that specifies your customer's preferred card brand

card-payment-checkout.description: A one-off card payment using the Checkout SDK to capture card details in a short lived session.

store-card-token.description: Card payment using a plain card number that will also create a Worldpay Token for use with future customer initiated transactions (CIT)

store-card-only-token.description:
Create a Worldpay Token for use with future customer initiated transactions (CIT)
* `value.amount` is set to `0` to indicate this is not a payment and a card verification will be performed instead

use-stored-card-token.description: Use a previously stored Worldpay token for a customer initiated payment (CIT)

use-stored-card-network-token.description: Use a previously stored network token for a customer initiated payment (CIT).

use-stored-card-checkout-cvc.description: Use a previously stored Worldpay token for a customer initiated transaction (CIT) and use the Checkout SDK (cvcSessionHref) to capture the CVC value

google-pay-encrypted.description: Provide the encrypted Google Pay payload

apple-pay-encrypted.description: Provide the encrypted Apple Pay payload

setup-recurring-subscription.description: Set up a recurring subscription payment (first). This is a customer initiated transaction (CIT)

setup-recurring-subscription-zero.description: Set up a recurring subscription payment (first). This is a customer initiated transaction (CIT)

subsequent-recurring-subscription.description: Subsequent payment as part of a recurring subscription series

setup-recurring-installment-merchant.description: Set up a recurring installment payment (first). This is a customer initiated transaction (CIT)

subsequent-recurring-installment-merchan.description: Set up a recurring subscription payment (first). This is a customer initiated transaction (CIT)

setup-recurring-installment-latam.description: Set up a Latin America installment payment. This is a customer initiated transaction (CIT)

recurring-unscheduled.description: Subsequent unscheduled payment as part of a customer agreement. This is a merchant initiated transaction (MIT).

authorized-201-basic.description: Example of an authorized response. Use the action `settlePayment` to complete the transaction

authorized-201-full.description:
Example of an authorized response. Use the action `settlePayment` to complete the transaction. 

Includes response information for: 
  - [Fraud assessment](/products/payments/enable-features/fraud-assessment) 
  - [Worldpay token creation](/products/payments/store-a-card)
  - [SCA Exemption](/products/payments/enable-features/sca-exemptions)
  - [Revenue Boost](/products/payments/openapi/payment/payment#payment/payment/t=response&c=201&path=&d=0/updatedpaymentinstrument)
  - [Account Updater](/products/payments/enable-features/account-updater)

3ds-device-data-required-201.description: If 3DS is enabled the issuers [device data collection](/products/payments/enable-features/3ds-authentication) must be run on the customer's browser

fs-highrisk.description: If [FraudSight is enabled](/products/payments/enable-features/fraud-assessment) the payment could be flagged as `fraudHighRisk`, stopping the request from proceeding any further

sent-for-settlement-202-basic.description: Example of a sentForSettlement response. [Auto settlement](/products/payments/enable-features/auto-settlement) was enabled in the payment request.

sent-for-settlement-202-full.description:
Example of a sentForSettlement response. [Auto settlement](/products/payments/enable-features/auto-settlement) was enabled in the payment request. 

Includes response information for: 
  - [fraud assessment](/products/payments/enable-features/fraud-assessment) 
  - [Worldpay Token creation](/products/payments/store-a-card)
  - [SCA Exemption](/products/payments/enable-features/sca-exemptions)
  - [Revenue Boost](/products/payments/openapi/payment/payment#payment/payment/t=response&c=202&path=&d=0/updatedpaymentinstrument)

3ds-challenged-201.description: As an additional fraud measure the issuer requests a [3DS challenge](../enable-3ds-authentication/web/#challenge--verification) to be performed

authorized-3ds-frictionless-201.description:
Example of an authorized response following a 3DS authentication without a challenge (frictionless). Use the action `settlePayment` to complete the transaction
* includes fraud, token and threeDS objects

3ds-unavailable-201.description: 3DS is unavailable when attempting authentication. If `/3dsChallenges` is called without completing the challenge this response may also be returned.

3ds-authentication-failed-201.description: Authentication failed by the issuer as part of a frictionless flow or the challenge (identity check) was attempted but failed by the customer

sent-for-settlement-3ds-frictionless-202.description:
Example of a sentForSettlement response following a 3DS authentication without a challenge (frictionless)
* auto settlement was enabled in the payments request
* includes fraud, token and threeDS objects

authorized-3ds-challenged-201.description:
Example of a authorized response following a successful 3DS challenge, use the action `settlePayment` to complete the transaction
* includes fraud, token and threeDS objects

sent-for-settlement-3ds-challenged-202.description:
Example of a sentForSettlement response following a successful 3DS challenge
* auto settlement was enabled in the payments request
* includes fraud, token and threeDS objects
